security_controls.relevance: Specifies that code changes (including automated ones) must be tracked and reviewed, aligning with the PR and approval workflow requirement.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure automated PRs include evidence of the vulnerability, suggested changes, and require at least one human reviewer before merge for sensitive fixes.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect PR workflows, confirm human approval requirements, and validate traceability between findings and PRs.

security_controls.requirement: Changes to information processing facilities and systems should be managed following formal change control processes.
security_controls.relevance: Auto-apply fixes must adhere to formal change management to ensure integrity and accountability of deployments.
security_controls.integration_tips: Tie auto-PRs to change tickets, require approvals for auto-apply in production, and maintain records of applied changes and approvals.
security_controls.verification_method: Review change records for auto-applied fixes, confirm approval traces, and test rollback processes.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Severity scoring, risk assessment, and contextual prioritization

security_controls.requirement: Conduct risk assessments to identify threats and vulnerabilities and determine risk levels for organizational operations and assets.
security_controls.relevance: Provides framework for scoring and assessing the risk of findings, which is necessary for prioritization and remediation planning.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement contextual scoring models that consider asset criticality, exploitability, and business impact; align scoring with organizational risk tolerance.
security_controls.verification_method: Review risk assessment methodology, sample scored findings and ensure scoring matches defined criteria and business context.

security_controls.requirement: Vulnerabilities should be prioritized by severity and context to guide remediation efforts.
security_controls.relevance: Directly supports contextual prioritization and severity scoring of vulnerabilities identified by the platform.
security_controls.integration_tips: Map scanner findings to severity taxonomies, incorporate context like code exposure and exploitability, and surface prioritized lists to developers.
security_controls.verification_method: Audit prioritization rules, check that critical items are consistently prioritized and tied to remediation plans.

security_controls.requirement: Information should be classified to support risk-based handling and prioritization.
security_controls.relevance: Classification of assets and codebases supports contextual prioritization by indicating sensitivity and business impact.
security_controls.integration_tips: Classify repositories and modules by criticality and exposure, and use classification to weight severity scoring for findings.
security_controls.verification_method: Check classification registers and verify scoring integrates classification attributes into prioritization.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Developer dashboards with personalized security metrics and trend analysis

security_controls.chapter: API and Web Services Verification Requirements
security_controls.requirement: APIs providing dashboards must enforce authentication, authorization, and secure data presentation.
security_controls.relevance: Dashboards expose sensitive security metrics per developer; API and UI must enforce access controls and secure handling of metrics.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement per-user RBAC, restrict metric visibility to permitted scopes, and sanitize any user-provided inputs used in dashboard queries.
security_controls.verification_method: Test API endpoints for access control bypass, review role mappings, and inspect UI rendering for sensitive data leaks.

security_controls.section: AU-6: Audit Review, Analysis, and Reporting
security_controls.requirement: Review and analyze audit records and report findings to support security monitoring and metrics.
security_controls.relevance: Dashboards should consume audited events and present trend analysis; AU-6 maps to creating reliable metrics from logs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Feed audited security events into metrics pipelines, ensure timestamps and user context are preserved, and implement access controls on metrics.
security_controls.verification_method: Compare dashboard metrics against raw audit logs to ensure accuracy and completeness.

security_controls.section: A.7.2.2 Information security awareness, education and training
security_controls.requirement: Employees should receive appropriate awareness and training to support information security responsibilities, enabling personalized metrics to drive improvements.
security_controls.relevance: Personalized metrics can be used to drive training and awareness; this control supports using dashboards for developer improvement.
security_controls.integration_tips: Map dashboard insights to training campaigns and provide links to remediation resources; ensure privacy-considerate presentation of developer metrics.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify links to training are available and that metrics are used in awareness programs.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Issue comment threads, collaboration features, and integration with Slack/Teams notifications

security_controls.chapter: API and Web Services Verification Requirements
security_controls.requirement: External integrations (e.g., Slack, Teams) must be authenticated and use secure channels.
security_controls.relevance: Notifications and comment integrations must be securely authenticated and ensure messages don't leak sensitive information.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use application-level tokens with minimum scopes for integrations, encrypt webhook payloads, and redact sensitive fields before sending notifications.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect integration tokens and scopes, verify payload encryption/signing, and test for sensitive data in notifications.

security_controls.requirement: The information system provides audit records for defined events to support incident notification and collaboration.
security_controls.relevance: Issue threads and notifications generate events that must be auditable for traceability and incident investigations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Log all collaboration events, map notification events to findings, and include correlation IDs to tie notifications back to findings.
security_controls.verification_method: Review audit logs for collaboration events and confirm correlation between notifications and logged events.

security_controls.section: A.13.2.1 Information Transfer Policies and Procedures
security_controls.requirement: Policies and procedures should be established for information transfer including notifications and collaboration channels.
security_controls.relevance: Provides policy-level guidance for handling notifications and collaboration channels to avoid inadvertent data exposure.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define acceptable messaging content, retention, and redaction rules for notifications; require approval for sending high-sensitivity data through channels.
security_controls.verification_method: Review information transfer policies and sample notification content for compliance with policies.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Integration with CI/CD pipelines for pre-merge and post-merge scanning

security_controls.requirement: Incorporate automated security testing into the development lifecycle and CI/CD pipelines.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies integrated security testing in CI/CD, covering pre-merge and post-merge scanning requirements.
security_controls.integration_tips: Embed static analysis, dependency scanning, and secret detection as pipeline stages and fail builds on critical findings; provide feedback in PR checks.
security_controls.verification_method: Review CI pipeline configs, confirm scans run on pre-merge and post-merge events, and validate PR blocking behavior for critical issues.

security_controls.section: SA-11: Developer Security Testing and Evaluation
security_controls.requirement: Require developer security testing and evaluation, including integration into build and CI/CD pipelines.
security_controls.relevance: Supports requirement to enforce security testing as part of CI/CD and developer workflows.
security_controls.integration_tips: Mandate pipeline gating for security checks, store results in centralized dashboards, and require remediation before merge for high-severity issues.
security_controls.verification_method: Confirm security tools are executed in pipelines, review gating rules, and examine historical pipeline runs for enforcement.

security_controls.requirement: Establish secure development policies including integration of security testing into development processes and pipelines.
security_controls.relevance: Policy-level requirement mandating inclusion of security in development that informs CI/CD integration choices.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document secure development requirements and enforce them via pipeline checks; require exception handling and approval for bypasses.
security_controls.verification_method: Review secure development policy and pipeline configurations for evidence of enforcement.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: OWASP Top 10 and custom security policy enforcement with customizable rules

security_controls.section: 14.4 Use of Security Policies and Standards
security_controls.requirement: Enforce security policies including OWASP Top 10 and provide mechanisms for custom rules and policy enforcement.
security_controls.relevance: Directly mandates policy enforcement including OWASP Top 10 and extensibility for custom rules aligning with the requirement.
security_controls.integration_tips: Provide configuration UI for custom rules, map findings to OWASP Top 10 categories, and allow policy-driven blocking or advisory actions.
security_controls.verification_method: Test custom rule creation, verify policy mapping to OWASP categories, and confirm enforcement in scans and gates.

security_controls.section: PL-2: System and Communications Protection Policy and Procedures
security_controls.requirement: Develop and disseminate system and communications protection policies and procedures tailored to system needs.
security_controls.relevance: Supports the existence of policies and procedures that define the security rules to be enforced by the platform.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document OWASP Top 10 mapping and custom rule lifecycle; communicate policy changes to users and enforce them via automated tooling.
security_controls.verification_method: Review policy documentation and evidence of dissemination; test that procedures are followed when rules are updated.

security_controls.requirement: Management should define a set of information security policies to provide management direction and support.
security_controls.relevance: Requires management-level approval for security policies which underlie enforcement of OWASP Top 10 and custom rules.
security_controls.integration_tips: Obtain policy approval for enforced rules, ensure responsibilities for rule management are assigned, and align with compliance requirements.
security_controls.verification_method: Check for signed policy documents and traceability between policies and enforcement mechanisms.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Audit logging and immutable records of findings, decisions, and remediation history

security_controls.requirement: The information system provides audit records for the organization-defined events to support after-action review and investigations.
security_controls.relevance: Auditing findings, decisions, and remediation actions requires defined audit events and logs as per AU-2.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define audit event taxonomy for findings lifecycle events, ensure timestamps and user IDs are captured, and route logs to a tamper-resistant store.
security_controls.verification_method: Review audit event definitions, sample logs for required events, and validate retention and integrity protections.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure that security-relevant events are logged with integrity and protected from tampering; maintain sufficient detail for investigations.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies log integrity and tamper protection necessary to maintain immutable records of findings and remediation history.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use append-only logs, cryptographic signing of log entries or WORM storage, and ensure access controls to prevent log modification.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify cryptographic log integrity, attempt tamper tests in controlled env, and review log access controls.

security_controls.requirement: Protect audit records from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion to preserve integrity of logs.
security_controls.relevance: Further enforces protection for audit records to ensure they remain immutable per requirement.
security_controls.integration_tips: Segment log storage, implement RBAC for log access, and use encryption and integrity checks for stored logs.
security_controls.verification_method: Review access lists for log storage, check encryption keys usage, and validate log retention policies.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Exportable compliance reports and evidence packages

security_controls.requirement: Information security should be reviewed regularly and results available to demonstrate compliance.
security_controls.relevance: Requires the ability to produce evidence and review results which align with generating exportable compliance reports and evidence packages.
security_controls.integration_tips: Design reporting features to include signed evidence, timestamps, and contextual logs; map report fields to compliance requirements.
security_controls.verification_method: Produce sample evidence packages for audits and confirm completeness against compliance checklists.

security_controls.requirement: Establish continuous monitoring processes to produce evidence and reports of system security status.
security_controls.relevance: Continuous monitoring provides the underlying data necessary for exportable compliance reports and evidence packaging.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement scheduled evidence exports, preserve raw logs for audits, and provide signed reports to demonstrate unaltered evidence.
security_controls.verification_method: Validate that continuous monitoring feeds into report generation and that exported reports contain verifiable signatures.

security_controls.chapter: API and Web Services Verification Requirements
security_controls.requirement: APIs that export reports must enforce access controls and ensure integrity of exported evidence.
security_controls.relevance: Export APIs must be protected to prevent unauthorized access or tampering with exported compliance evidence.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require authenticated, authorized requests for exports, log export events, and sign exported packages using organizational keys.
security_controls.verification_method: Test export APIs for access control enforcement and verify signatures on exported packages.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Model management: inference API endpoints, versioning, A/B testing, performance monitoring, and drift detection

security_controls.section: SA-15: Development Process, Standards, and Tools
security_controls.requirement: The organization ensures development processes and tools support secure design, testing, versioning and management of components such as models.
security_controls.relevance: Supports a structured approach to managing model lifecycle, versioning and testing (A/B) as part of secure development processes.
security_controls.integration_tips: Adopt model governance frameworks, keep version metadata, manage access to model artifacts, and ensure scripted promotion paths with approvals.
security_controls.verification_method: Review governance artifacts, model registries, A/B testing configs, and access controls for model artifacts.

security_controls.chapter: API and Web Services Verification Requirements
security_controls.requirement: Ensure API endpoints enforce authentication, authorization, and logging to support management and auditing of model endpoints.
security_controls.relevance: Inference endpoints must be protected and logged to support model management including versioning and performance tracking.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include version identifiers in API paths or headers, enforce scoped access for model operations, and collect performance telemetry for drift detection.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify authN/Z on endpoints, confirm version headers are present in logs, and review telemetry ingestion.

security_controls.requirement: Monitor the information system to detect attacks and potential misuse, including monitoring model performance and anomalies.
security_controls.relevance: Monitoring for drift and abnormal model behavior maps to SI-4's requirement for system monitoring.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement alerts for performance regressions, model output anomalies, and integrate monitoring with incident workflows for model roll-back.
security_controls.verification_method: Review monitoring rules, simulate drift scenarios, and confirm alerts trigger defined responses.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Custom model training on organization codebases with privacy-preserving controls

security_controls.requirement: Define acceptable use and rules for systems handling sensitive data including restrictions for training data usage.
security_controls.relevance: Using org codebases for model training requires clear rules defining consent, allowed use, and privacy-preserving constraints.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define acceptable-use agreements, require data minimization and anonymization before training, and log consent and provenance of training data.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect rules of behavior, check anonymization pipelines, and confirm consent records for training datasets.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure appropriate handling of assets including data used for training, protecting confidentiality and privacy.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies safe handling of data assets, which applies to codebases used for custom model training and privacy controls.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement handling procedures for training data, restrict access, and apply privacy-preserving techniques like differential privacy where required.
security_controls.verification_method: Audit access to training datasets and review applied privacy-preserving measures and their tuning parameters.

security_controls.requirement: Protect sensitive data used for model training and avoid inclusion of secrets in training datasets.
security_controls.relevance: Prevents leakage of secrets into trained models and enforces cleaning and scanning prior to using code as training data.
security_controls.integration_tips: Scan and sanitize training corpora to remove secrets, apply redaction, and incorporate data provenance metadata to track origin and transformations.
security_controls.verification_method: Run secret scans on training datasets, validate redaction effectiveness, and review provenance logs.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Secure storage and handling of code snippets, tokens, keys, and analysis results (encryption, retention, redaction)

security_controls.requirement: Employ cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of information.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates encryption of sensitive artifacts (tokens, keys, snippets) at rest and in transit.
security_controls.integration_tips: Encrypt data-at-rest with key management, TLS for transit, and ensure encryption keys are stored in a dedicated KMS with access controls.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify encryption configuration, test data retrieval unauthorized attempts, and review KMS access logs.

security_controls.section: A.10.1.1 Policy on the use of cryptographic controls
security_controls.requirement: A policy on the use of cryptographic controls should be developed and implemented; protect keys and sensitive data.
security_controls.relevance: Requires organizational policy guiding encryption, retention and redaction of sensitive stored data consistent with the requirement.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define retention schedules, redaction rules for stored results, and key rotation policies in alignment with the cryptography policy.
security_controls.verification_method: Review cryptography policy and sample stored artifacts for correct encryption and redaction settings.

security_controls.requirement: Sensitive data at rest and in transit must be protected using strong cryptography; implement key management.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies practical data protection measures (encryption, key management, redaction) for code snippets and tokens.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement field-level redaction, encrypt databases and object storage for analysis results, and store tokens in vaults not in code or plain DB fields.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect encryption settings, redaction logic, and confirm secrets are stored only in approved vaults with access auditing.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Vulnerability database management and mapping to CVE/NVD feeds

security_controls.requirement: Maintain an inventory of system components and correlate with known vulnerabilities and feeds to manage vulnerabilities.
security_controls.relevance: Maintaining an inventory and mapping to CVE/NVD is core to managing vulnerabilities discovered via dependency scanning and component analysis.
security_controls.integration_tips: Keep automated inventories (SBOM), ingest NVD feeds, auto-correlate component versions to CVEs, and flag impacted systems.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify SBOM accuracy, correlation logs showing CVE matches, and check records of vulnerability notifications and remediations.

security_controls.requirement: Verify and manage third-party components and dependencies; ensure known vulnerabilities are tracked and remediated.
security_controls.relevance: Direct guidance to track third-party component vulnerabilities and remediate based on feeds like CVE/NVD.
security_controls.integration_tips: Automate periodic feed ingestion, implement matching algorithms to identify impacted versions, and assign remediation tickets.
security_controls.verification_method: Review feed ingestion logs, confirm CVE-to-component mappings, and check remediation ticket lifecycle.

security_controls.requirement: Obtain and evaluate information about technical vulnerabilities and take appropriate measures to address them.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates operational process for vulnerability feed evaluation and measures — applies to mapping CVE/NVD into platform workflows.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define SLAs for vulnerability evaluation, maintain a feed processing pipeline, and provide visibility to stakeholders on findings.
security_controls.verification_method: Examine vulnerability management reports, SLA adherence, and evidence of action on identified CVEs.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Caching of analysis results for performance with cache invalidation policies

security_controls.requirement: Protect system availability including caching mechanisms that may affect availability and implement controls to mitigate DoS and stale data.
security_controls.relevance: Caching can affect availability and stale results; SC-5 maps to protecting availability and ensuring cache policies don't lead to DoS or stale/inaccurate findings.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement cache eviction, TTL, and capacity controls; protect cache endpoints from abuse and ensure invalidation on repository changes.
security_controls.verification_method: Test cache invalidation on commits, simulate heavy load and confirm DoS protections and cache limits.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure correct state management and caching strategies that do not leak sensitive data or create stale/inaccurate results.
security_controls.relevance: Addresses state and caching correctness to prevent stale or sensitive data being served in caches.
security_controls.integration_tips: Separate caches by tenancy/repo scope, implement per-item TTLs, and ensure caches are invalidated on PRs or commits that change analysis context.
security_controls.verification_method: Review cache configuration, run invalidation scenarios, and check caches for unexpectedly persisted sensitive data.

security_controls.requirement: Establish and document baseline configurations and settings for caching behaviors including invalidation policies.
security_controls.relevance: Requires documented config and baseline for caching behavior which helps ensure consistent invalidation policies and performance tuning.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document cache baselines, include recommended TTLs, and ensure configuration is part of deployment manifests with change control.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify documented cache baselines and inspect deployed configurations for alignment.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Access control and RBAC for repo access, model access, and UI/API operations

security_controls.requirement: Manage information system accounts including provisioning, de-provisioning, and role assignments.
security_controls.relevance: RBAC and account lifecycle management are necessary to control repo/model/UI/API access across the platform.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement automated provisioning/deprovisioning tied to identity sources, enforce least privilege and role reviews, and maintain account inventories.
security_controls.verification_method: Review account provisioning logs, role assignments and deprovision records; perform access reviews.

security_controls.requirement: Implement robust authentication and session controls and role-based access control for applications and APIs.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies implementing RBAC for application/API sessions to control access to sensitive operations like model use or repo modifications.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define roles for repo admins, reviewers, model trainers; implement session timeouts, consent-based scopes, and token revocation for role changes.
security_controls.verification_method: Test role-based access enforcement for UI and APIs and verify session handling behaviors.

security_controls.section: A.9.1.2 Access to networks and network services
security_controls.requirement: Users should only be provided access to network services necessary to perform their role.
security_controls.relevance: Supports least privilege and RBAC by restricting access to only necessary services and platform functions.
security_controls.integration_tips: Segment admin functions into separate services and apply RBAC at service and API levels; enforce network segmentation where appropriate.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect access policies and run access tests to confirm role-appropriate service access.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Rate limiting, abuse prevention, and API authentication/authorization

security_controls.chapter: API and Web Services Verification Requirements
security_controls.requirement: Ensure APIs enforce authentication, authorization, rate limiting and input/output validation to prevent abuse.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable: enforces rate limiting and abuse prevention controls on APIs used for inference and scanning.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement per-API and per-user throttle limits, API keys with quotas, usage monitoring and automated throttling on anomalous behavior.
security_controls.verification_method: Run load and abuse tests to confirm throttling, inspect auth/authorization policies and quota enforcement logs.

security_controls.requirement: Manage authenticators and credentials and protect against misuse and brute-force or credential stuffing attacks.
security_controls.relevance: Helps prevent abuse by ensuring robust authenticator management and protections against credential-based attacks on APIs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce strong credential policies, lockout thresholds, multi-factor authentication for privileged API access, and monitor for credential misuse.
security_controls.verification_method: Review authenticator policies, test brute-force protections and check account lockout logs.

security_controls.requirement: Networks should be managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications, including controls to mitigate abuse and overload.
security_controls.relevance: Network-level controls complement API rate limiting to prevent overload and abuse impacting service availability.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply rate limiting at edge proxies, use WAF and DDoS protections, and configure network ACLs to mitigate abusive traffic sources.
security_controls.verification_method: Review edge proxy configs, WAF rules, and DDoS protection telemetry during simulated abuse.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Support for on-premises or isolated VPC/SaaS deployment models and data residency controls

security_controls.requirement: Support secure deployment models including separated environments, hardened infrastructure and data residency controls.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies secure deployment approaches and supports differentiating on-prem/VPC or SaaS with data residency controls.
security_controls.integration_tips: Offer configurable deployment templates for on-prem and VPC isolate; implement data locality tagging and policies to restrict cross-border data movements.
security_controls.verification_method: Review deployment manifests for isolation features and validate data residency enforcement in sample deployments.

security_controls.requirement: Monitor and control communications at external boundaries and implement deployment-specific network segmentation such as VPC isolation.
security_controls.relevance: Maps to implementing VPC isolation and boundary protections for on-prem and isolated deployments.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use network segmentation, private endpoints, and peering controls to enforce isolation; restrict management interfaces to secure management networks.
security_controls.verification_method: Pen-test network boundaries, inspect VPC configs, and verify management plane access restrictions.

security_controls.requirement: Define and communicate acceptable use of organizational assets including deployment choices affecting data location and handling.
security_controls.relevance: Policy-level control to ensure data residency and deployment choices are authoritative and administratively enforced.
security_controls.integration_tips: Provide customers with clear acceptable-use and data residency options in contracts and deployment docs; enforce via deployment automation.
security_controls.verification_method: Review contractual terms, deployment records and customer configuration options for compliance to stated residency.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Consent, data usage policies, and ability to opt-in/opt-out model training on customer code

security_controls.section: A.18.1.4 Privacy and protection of personally identifiable information
security_controls.requirement: Ensure privacy and protection measures for PII and comply with applicable privacy laws, including consent for data use.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies need for consent and privacy protections which directly apply to opt-in/opt-out model training decisions for customer code (which may include PII).
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement consent capture UI, store consent metadata with datasets, and enforce opt-out by excluding datasets from training pipelines.
security_controls.verification_method: Review consent records, confirm excluded datasets are omitted from training, and audit model training inputs for PII.

security_controls.requirement: Define rules and agreements for acceptable use, including consent and data usage policies for customers.
security_controls.relevance: Supports documenting and enforcing rules of behavior and data usage policies for customers regarding model training.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define and communicate clear opt-in/out mechanisms, include data usage terms in contracts and UI consent, and log customer preferences.
security_controls.verification_method: Check rules of behavior documentation and verify system honors stored user preferences during training runs.

security_controls.requirement: Protect data and ensure proper handling including consent and data usage policies for training or analysis datasets.
security_controls.relevance: Reinforces need to protect data used for training and ensure customer consent is respected and enforced.
security_controls.integration_tips: Tag datasets with consent metadata, enforce dataset filters in training pipelines that honor opt-out tags, and provide customers audit evidence.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect dataset tagging and training pipelines, confirm that opt-out tags prevent inclusion in training datasets.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Monitoring, alerting, and incident response for platform security (SIEM integration)

security_controls.requirement: Monitor the information system to detect attacks and potential misuse and send alerts to administrators.
security_controls.relevance: Core to SIEM integration: requires monitoring and alerting to detect anomalies, misuse, and security events in the platform.
security_controls.integration_tips: Forward application and infrastructure logs to SIEM, implement correlation rules for key events (auth failures, suspicious model queries), and configure alerting thresholds.
security_controls.verification_method: Validate SIEM ingests logs, simulate incidents and confirm alerts, and review incident ticket creation.

security_controls.section: A.16.1.5 Response to information security incidents
security_controls.requirement: Establish responsibilities and procedures to ensure a quick, effective and orderly response to information security incidents.
security_controls.relevance: Defines incident response processes which must be integrated with monitoring/alerting and SIEM to handle platform security events.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document incident response playbooks for platform-specific incidents, integrate SIEM alerts into incident workflows and perform regular exercises.
security_controls.verification_method: Review incident response plans, confirm SOPs for SIEM alerts, and evaluate results of tabletop or live exercises.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure detection and response capabilities are in place with integrated logs and monitoring to support incident response.
security_controls.relevance: Requires application-level logging and integration with monitoring tools to support SIEM and IR activities for the platform.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure application logs include context (user, repo, model version), push logs to SIEM, and configure runbooks for prioritized alerts.
security_controls.verification_method: Audit logs for required context fields, verify SIEM correlation rules and test full incident response flow.

cross_functional_controls.description: Comprehensive logging of authentication events, API calls, model inferences, scans, PR actions, and remediation decisions with protections for integrity and retention.
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Implement structured, tamper-evident logs with correlation IDs, forward to centralized SIEM, protect logs with RBAC and encryption, and retain logs per compliance retention schedules.

cross_functional_controls.description: Encrypt sensitive data at rest and in transit, and manage keys using a centralized KMS with rotation and access controls.
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Use TLS for transport, AES-256 for storage, KMS-backed envelope encryption, enforce key rotation policies, and restrict KMS access via IAM roles.

cross_functional_controls.description: Centralized role-based access control for repository access, model operations, APIs and UI functions with account lifecycle management.
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Integrate with enterprise identity providers, implement least privilege roles, periodic access reviews, and automated provisioning/deprovisioning.

cross_functional_controls.description: Policies and technical controls for data handling including consent, opt-in/opt-out for training, redaction, anonymization, and data residency enforcement.
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Capture consent metadata, tag datasets with residency and sensitivity, apply anonymization/differential privacy for training, and enforce opt-out filters in pipelines.
